groups.name: spalloc.historical-data
groups.description: How to handle job data that is now only of historic interest.

groups.name: spalloc.allocator
groups.description: Configuration of the main resource allocation engine.

groups.name: spalloc.allocator.priority-scale
groups.description: Priority is the rate at which importance is accrued. Importance is determines the order in which jobs are allocated.

groups.name: spalloc.allocator.report-email
groups.description: Notify an administrator about problems reported with boards.

groups.name: spalloc.transceiver
groups.description: Controls how Spalloc talks to BMPs on machines.

groups.name: spalloc.compat
groups.description: Settings relationg to the v1 spalloc configuration interface.

properties.name: cxf.jaxrs.component-scan
properties.description: Whether to scan for Spring components

properties.name: cxf.jaxrs.classes-scan-packages
properties.description: Comma-separated list (in a string) of package names to scan

properties.name: spalloc.database-path
properties.description: Path to the main database file

properties.name: spalloc.wait
properties.description: How long should long calls take before returning anyway?

properties.name: spalloc.historical-data.path
properties.description: Path to the historical job database file

properties.name: spalloc.historical-data.schedule
properties.description: Cron expression saying when to move completed jobs to the historical database

properties.name: spalloc.historical-data.grace-period
properties.description: How long after job completion should we wait before moving the data?

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.period
properties.description: Time between runs of the main allocation algorithm.

properties.name: spalloc.keepalive.expiry-period
properties.description: Time between runs of the keepalive-expiry algorithm.

properties.name: spalloc.keepalive.min
properties.description: Minimum keepalive period.

properties.name: spalloc.keepalive.max
properties.description: Maximum keepalive period.

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.importance-span
properties.description: Maximum span of job importance that will be allocated at once. Priority is the rate at which importance is accrued.

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.priority-scale.size
properties.description: Priority scaling factor for jobs given by number of boards

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.priority-scale.dimensions
properties.description: Priority scaling factor for jobs given by rectangular dimensions

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.priority-scale.specific-board
properties.description: Priority scaling factor for jobs requiring a specific board

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.report-email.send
properties.description: Whether to send an email about reported boards

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.report-email.from
properties.description: From: email address

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.report-email.to
properties.description: To: email address

properties.name: spalloc.allocator.report-email.subject
properties.description: Email subject

properties.name: spalloc.transceiver.dummy
properties.description: Whether to use a dummy transceiver. Useful for testing only.

properties.name: spalloc.transceiver.period
properties.description: How long between when we send requests to the BMP control tasks.

properties.name: spalloc.transceiver.probe-interval
properties.description: The basic wait time used by the BMP control tasks.

properties.name: spalloc.transceiver.power-attempts
properties.description: Number of attempts that will be made to switch on a board.

properties.name: spalloc.transceiver.fpga-attempts
properties.description: Number of attempts that will be made to bring up an FPGA.

properties.name: spalloc.auth.basic
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP BASIC authentication. Useful for simple clients.

properties.name: spalloc.auth.local-form
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP form+session authentication. Much faster than BASIC, but requires a more complex client. You must enable this if you are supporting the Web UI.

properties.name: spalloc.auth.add-dummy-user
properties.description: Force a known local admin user to exist with a known password

properties.name: spalloc.auth.dummy-random-pass
properties.description: Whether to generate a random password for the above user. If so, the password will be written to the log.

properties.name: spalloc.auth.debug-failures
properties.description: Provide extra information to callers on auth failures

properties.name: spalloc.auth.max-login-failures
properties.description: Number of login failures before automatic lock-out

properties.name: spalloc.auth.account-lock-duration
properties.description: Length of time that automatic lock-out lasts

properties.name: spalloc.auth.unlock-period
properties.description: How often do we look for users to end their lock-out?

properties.name: spalloc.quota.default
properties.description: Default user quota in board-seconds

properties.name: spalloc.quota.consolidation-schedule
properties.description: Cron expression that says when we consolidate job quotas into the main quota table.

properties.name: spalloc.sqlite.timeout
properties.description: How long to wait to get a database lock

properties.name: spalloc.sqlite.debug-failures
properties.description: Whether to send details of SQL-related exceptions to users

properties.name: spalloc.sqlite.analysis-limit
properties.description: Amount of effort to spend on DB optimization on application close; see SQLite documentation for meaning. Note that this is spent by every worker thread that touches the database.

properties.name: spalloc.compat.enable
properties.description: Whether to turn the spalloc version 1 compatibility service interface on.

properties.name: spalloc.compat.thread-pool-size
properties.description: The number of threads to use to service the spalloc v1 compatibility service. 0 means no limit.

properties.name: spalloc.compat.port
properties.description: What port to run the spalloc v1 compatibility service on.

properties.name: spalloc.compat.service-user
properties.description: What user to run jobs submitted through the spalloc v1 compatibility service as. We recommend that this user exists but is disabled (i.e., login using this service identity need not be supported).
